answers.author: Roderick Wood
answers.text:
It is likely that the bus, depending on the size of the bus, may actually cause more damage then the 1,000 cars.  Buses are heavy and cause a lot more road ware and damage then cars.  If you are in a urban area with buses in drive in the right lane you will experience this situation.  The purpose for promoting transit really relates to other factors such as social need for these without cars and reducing air pollution.  Ultimately the more convenient, time saving  and costs saving transit is the more people will switch.

author: Megan Bourke
text:
Has anyone done an analysis about the cost of a car trip over a mile of roadway? I'm trying to analyze the benefit of funding a public bus line in terms of maintenance dollars saved. If a bus line took 1000 cars off the road, how much money would I save on roadway maintenance?
Thanks,
Megan
bourkem@chesterfield.gov
title: Cost of a car trip in road maintenance dollars
